siteMetadata.about:
Hi, I'm Liza Katz. (aka Lizozom)


I am a Senior Software Engineer and Consultant with over 20 years of experience building large-scale backend systems.


While the industry chases hype, I focus on the complex intersection of Search Infrastructure (Elasticsearch/OpenSearch) and Generative AI. I help companies move RAG and vector search from "promising POC" to scalable production architecture.


Beyond consulting, I believe in demystifying technology. I created the "WTF Are Embeddings?" talk, I deliver workshops, lead hackathons and speak frequently at events like PyCon and BuildStuff.


When I'm not debugging pipelines, I'm designing interiors, listening to ABBA, or negotiating with my three cats: Pita, Chooka, and Chonky.

I’ll be speaking at Build Stuff in Vilnius, Lithuania this December. Looking forward to it!

Building Advanced RAGs with Elasticsearch / OpenSearch

RAG (Retrieval Augmented Generation) is built in three steps: understanding the query, executing a retrieval step, and generating a response. Each step has its own unique characteristics and challenges.

In this session, we’ll go through common pitfalls (and solutions!) for each step, and demonstrate how you can build an efficient RAG using Elasticsearch or OpenSearch.

What to expect

We’ll cover:

  • Query processing and intent understanding
  • Effective retrieval strategies
  • Response generation techniques
  • Real-world examples and practical patterns

The focus is on the practical stuff - the challenges you actually run into when building RAG systems in production, not just the happy path demos.

Details

When: December 3-5, 2025
Where: Vilnius, Lithuania
Conference: Built Stuff

If you’re interested in attending, there’s a 15% discount available.
